values.title: Do not use raw/default/ in includes links

summary.html:
Looks like something in the publish mechanism is adding an extra /default/ after raw in includes links so the proper use should be:

#!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/raw/$tutorial/file/foo.py

Note that this is different from the standard links used in markdown which should add the default to work.

#!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/raw/default/$tutorial/file/foo.py

@nkoenig just to confirm that this is by design.

values.description:
I was checking the broken links and here is the first set of patches.

A couple of things more:

 * We should delete http://www.sdformat.org/user_guide/overview.html, old and probably unmaintained.
 * The gazebo user_guide was removed, wasn't it? If that is the case, where should I point to a link to the old started_model_database? In the scope:

~~~ 
Read through the Model Database documentation. You will be creating your own model, which must follow the formatting rules for the Gazebo Model Database directory structure.
~~~
values.title: Missing links and images

summary.raw:
I was checking the broken links and here is the first set of patches.

A couple of things more:

 * We should delete http://www.sdformat.org/user_guide/overview.html, old and probably unmaintained.
 * The gazebo user_guide was removed, wasn't it? If that is the case, where should I point to a link to the old started_model_database? In the scope:

~~~ 
Read through the Model Database documentation. You will be creating your own model, which must follow the formatting rules for the Gazebo Model Database directory structure.
~~~
summary.html:
I was checking the broken links and here is the first set of patches.

A couple of things more:

  • We should delete http://www.sdformat.org/user_guide/overview.html, old and probably unmaintained.
  • The gazebo user_guide was removed, wasn't it? If that is the case, where should I point to a link to the old started_model_database? In the scope:
Read through the Model Database documentation. You will be creating your own model, which must follow the formatting rules for the Gazebo Model Database directory structure.

values.description:
This requires a [gazebo pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1181/add-ability-to-specify-gui-plugins-that/diff).

Before I merge this pull request, I need to replace all "raw/gui_plugins" instances with "raw/default". The former is in place so that you can test the tutorial.

values.description:
Replacing the old: http://wiki.gazebosim.org/index.php?title=Install/Gazebo_and_ROS

My first plan was to merge it with ros_install but I don't like to make longer the current version. I will send a new release update ros_install which includes a mention to read this tutorial first when installing the ros_gazebo_pkgs.
values.title: New tutorial to replace Gazebo_and_ROS

values.description:
Updated pictures and minor fixes to drcsim_modify_world tutorial text

Also, I found a bug in loading atlas when the model is included in a world file. I'm submitting a drcsim pull request to fix it (thanks to @hsu for the debugging help).
values.title: drcsim_modify_world update

summary.raw:
Updated pictures and minor fixes to drcsim_modify_world tutorial text

Also, I found a bug in loading atlas when the model is included in a world file. I'm submitting a drcsim pull request to fix it (thanks to @hsu for the debugging help).
summary.html:
Updated pictures and minor fixes to drcsim_modify_world tutorial text

Also, I found a bug in loading atlas when the model is included in a world file. I'm submitting a drcsim pull request to fix it (thanks to @hsu for the debugging help).

values.title: Improve documentation on binary compatible Gazebo/ROS

values.description:
4 new tutorials:
* installation
* pu/sub
* camera images
* model sdf information

Notes:
  The images won't show up before the PR is merged.
  The gazebojs source code is in the gazebojs  repo.
  I'd like to make sure that setup is robust, so please document any problems / workaround.
values.title: GazeboJs : NodeJs bindings for Gazebo

summary.raw:

summary.html:
4 new tutorials: installation pu/sub camera images model sdf information

Notes: The images won't show up before the PR is merged. The gazebojs source code is in the gazebojs repo. I'd like to make sure that setup is robust, so please document any problems / workaround.
